Chinese Wikipedia Cites Dr. Toast

posted January 14, 2011 | toast-news, toasters

Way back near the beginning of my illustrious career, I posted on this blog my original research on the history of the toaster.

(Briefly: it was accidentally invented in 1491 by an obscure French alchemist named Gerard Depardieu, who was actually trying to turn bread into gold. He also had to invent plastic and electricity.)

In 2008, the Chinese version of the Wikipedia article on toast cited this research as fact. It remained on Wikipedia for over two years before it was finally removed by overzealous "truthists."

Here's how it looked in 2010: (apparently there is no Chinese character for "Gerard Depardieu")


And, Google Translated into English: ("citation needed")


Dr. Toast Live @ Transported

posted January 4, 2011 | music, shows

Tuesday, January 11, 2011, 8pm-11:11pm - The Dr. is excited to once again have the opportunity to play some new music on a super awesome mobile lounge-with-soundsystem, along with F'kir, courtesy of our good friends at Transported. We'll travel to secret destinations while the music plays, then pour out of the bus and unload the speakers wherever we end up, and dance. BYOB. What's not to like? [tickets, map]

Toast Animation

Dr. Toast Live @ Burning Man 2010

posted August 26, 2010 | music, shows

August 30-September 6, 2010: Dr. Toast at Burning Man 2010!

Tuesday, 12-2pm: Inside the Hookahdome: "Hookahdome is a chill lounge which incorporates flavored tabacco / shisha, tea and snack table service in an Arabic-themed, air-conditioned geodesic dome. Our guests lay back in Sultanic luxury and enjoy entertainment by our exquisite belly-dancers, acrobats, musicians and DJs while our lovely and attentive hospitality hosts & hostesses attend to their every want and need."


Wednesday, around sunrise: The False Profit Tuesday Party (located at 4:30 and Esplanade) is a Burning Man institution, and Dr. Toast is honored to continue his tradition of providing the soundtrack for the sunrise. Also, ALXNDR :: DJJD :: Dr. Toast :: Eugene Steele :: F’kir :: Ill Gates :: Kapt’n Kirk :: Lokae :: Mancub :: R/D :: Shipwreck :: and special guests. Sound provided by the Space Cowboys' Unimog.



Whenever: The Dr. is also expected to make spontaneous appearances on art cars such as The Jelly, The Phage, and The Janky Barge!


Dr. Toast Live @ Priceless 2010

posted June 17, 2010 | music, shows

July 2-5, 2010 - Belden, CA - Come dance by the banks of the Feather River to the dulcet tones of Dr. Toast and some of his favorite musicians, including David Last, Kid Kameleon, Shipwrek, Nanda, Retic, and lots more - "Just four hours north of San Francisco we will celebrate under the stars surrounded by the majestic Sierra Nevada mountains. This is our fifth anniversary! We're pulling out all the stops and adding an extra day. Come get crazy with us."

Four days of incredible art and music! For more info, visit priceless.false-profit.com.


Dr. Toast Live @ The Big Bounce

posted June 17, 2010 | music, shows

June 18-20, 2010 - Belden, CA - Dr. Toast joins Dubtribe Sound System, DJ Vadim, Beats Antique, Random Rab, Eskmo, Kraddy, MiMOSA, and many more amazing artists for a three-day festival in the sunny California mountains at a beautiful forested creekside location. Join Dr. Toast for sunrise on the beach stage early Saturday morning! [info, map, tickets]


Dr. Toast Live @ California Academy of Sciences

posted June 8, 2010 | music, shows

Thursday, June 10, 2010, 6pm-10pm - Dr. Toast performs in the aquarium at the California Academy of Sciences' NightLife series! Come to celebrate World Oceans Day and wander the halls and galleries of this amazing science museum in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park. Listen to music, enjoy a cocktail, and mingle with friends... Watch sustainable seafood cooking demonstrations by chefs from acclaimed San Francisco restaurants... See the unveiling of a new art project by The Crucible featuring copper and steel constructed over an ocean of beautifully colored glass... DJ MyKill will provide the music on the main floor, and Evolutionista and Dr. Toast will be providing the soundtrack in the aquarium. [event info, tickets, map]



Toast and Dr. Pepper for Mother's Day

posted May 9, 2010 | toast-articles

I was just trying out booshaka.com, a search engine for Facebook, and typed in the words "Dr." and "Toast". While my vanity search didn't pan out, I did discover that lots of kids like to serve their moms breakfast in bed with toast and Dr. Pepper.

Martha: "Awesome breakfast made by my awesome son for mothers day! Eggs, bacon, pancakes, toast and dt dr pepper! Ah i love my kids!" 5 hours ago

Sonya: "Breakfast in bed for mothers day... Apple Jacks,, toast with jelly,, an orange and a Dr. Pepper!! They are too sweet!! Love you kiddos!!" 5 hours ago

Crystal: "So I have the most wonderful boys ever. They made me breakfast in bed. Oatmeal, toast, and dr. Pepper. Cute for three little boys. I love them dearly." 7 hours ago

Laverna: "Mother's Day memories of a small boy and girl proudly serving Mother breakast in bed. Rubbery eggs, toast with the burned part scraped off, a weiner split and cooked, flowers from the yard and a Dr. Pepper wrapped in foil...a priceless gift that can never be equaled and will never be forgotten. Thank you David and Darla. What a privilege it is to be your Mother." 8 hours ago

Linda: "Favorite Mother's Day memory. My oldest child was 5, and on his own he made me a Pop Tart and a piece of toast with jelly, put it on a tray with a can of Diet Dr. Pepper, and brought me breakfast in bed. :-) -- LJ" 9 hours ago

Tiffany: "Enjoyed a Mother's Day breakfast in bed...eggs, toast, & a can of Dr. Pepper! How thoughtful!" 9 hours ago

Heather: "HAPPY MOTHERS DAY!! Thought this would be my one day to sleep in but instead my wonderful children brought me breakfast ( special k bar, peanut butter toast, pudding, and a dr pepper) in bed at 6:30 this morning." 11 hours ago

Dr. Toast Live on the Transported Bus

posted May 4, 2010 | music, shows

Thursday, May 13, 2010, 8:30-11pm - What's the big rush? Dr. Toast and Fkir. On a bus. 25mph speed limit. 100 BPM music tempo limit. Your cell phone: off. No, vibrate ≠ off. No, silent ≠ off. Off = off... Tickets are $21 and are available here (this is one time you might want to rush, however, as this will sell out). We meet at the Bus Stop Gallery at 7:30pm for check-in and our bus leaves at 8pm.

Oh, by the way, our bus: biodiesel. Did I mention the it has couches, a dancefloor, and a sound system? Said sound system: powered by solar panels on the roof. [facebook, tickets, info, map]

More info: http://transportedsf.com/


Dr. Toast Live @ Ecstatic Dance

posted April 27, 2010 | music, shows

Wednesday, April 28, 2010, 8-11pm - Historic Sweet's Ballroom @ 1933 Broadway, Oakland, CA [map, info]. Here are the simple guidelines for Ecstatic Dance:

1. No talking on the dance floor
2. Scent-free environment
3. No photos or videos
4. Respect the space
5. Dance however you wish
